V Bohinju brez zdravnikov, pogovarjajo se s tistimi z območja nekdanje Jugoslavije
Omejiti so morali delovni čas.
05 Nov 2019, 11:29 by STA, T. V.
BOHINJ – Zdravstveni dom (ZD) Bohinj je zaradi pomanjkanja zdravnikov primoran omejiti delovni čas. Danes in še nekaj delovnih dni v novembru bo zdravnik družinske medicine prisoten le v dopoldanskem času. Podobne težave se nakazujejo tudi v prihodnje, poznajo pa jih že denimo v Kranjski Gori, kjer prav tako prihaja do občasnih omejitev.V ZD Bohinj so zaposlene tri zdravnice družinske medicine, ki izvajajo kurativno in preventivno dejavnost, enkrat tedensko imajo ambulanto v domu starostnikov, vsak dan pa ob svojem rednem delu v ambulanti izvajajo tudi nujno medicinsko pomoč in obveznosti nadomeščanja, mrliško službo in druge naloge.»Zaradi raznih objektivnih odsotnosti vseh treh zdravnic družinske medicine v novembru in tudi v naslednjih mesecih ter ob velikem pomanjkanju zdravnikov tako na Gorenjskem kot tudi v celotni Sloveniji ugotavljamo, da ne bo možno vsak dan med 7. in 20. uro organizirati prisotnosti zdravnika družinske medicine v Zdravstvenem domu Bohinj,« so Bohinjce obvestili iz Osnovnega zdravstva Gorenjske (OZG).
Nujna pomoč na Bledu
Danes in 11., 12. in 28. novembra bo tako zdravnik družinske medicine v Bohinju prisoten le do 13.30, 13. novembra bo ZD Bohinj zaprt od 17.30 dalje, 27. novembra pa od 11.30 dalje. V tem času bo občanom in bolnikom zagotovljena nujna medicinska pomoč v ZD Bled.»Vodstvo zavoda OZG in zaposleni v ZD Bohinj se opravičujemo, vendar glede na trenutno stanje, drugačna organizacija ni možna,« so pojasnili. Direktor OZG Jože Veternik je za STA povedal, da bodo prihodnji teden na sestanku s predstavniki občine in zdravnicami iskali rešitev za naprej. V Bohinju so vajeni, da je zdravnik prisoten. Kot je pojasnil Veternik, so namreč vsaj zadnjih 20 let, odkar je v OZG, kljub težavam, ki so jih imeli, sedaj prvič primorani v ta ukrep. Prej so uspeli težave reševati zlasti z mladimi zdravniki iz drugih zdravstvenih domov.
V Kranjski Gori še hujše
S tremi zdravnicami je glede na različne odsotnosti namreč zelo težko zagotavljati neprekinjeno zdravstveno varstvo, prav tako je težko zagotavljati nadomeščanja, saj tudi na Bledu manjka zdravnikov. Splošnih zdravnikov in specializantov pa primanjkuje tudi drugod po Gorenjskem, je pojasnil Veternik.V Kranjski Gori je situacija še slabša kot v Bohinju, saj delata le dva zdravnika, brez pomoči zdravnikov z Jesenic pa sploh ne bi bilo mogoče normalno organizirati dela. Kljub temu občasno prihaja do izpada, ko ne morejo zagotoviti prisotnosti zdravnika ves dan. Celodnevnih ambulant pa sicer nimajo tudi v nekaterih manjših krajih, kot so Cerklje, Preddvor, Šenčur in Naklo.
V Kranju se stanje ureja
V ZD Kranj, kjer so letos izbruhnile največje težave in kjer so zdravniki spomladi napovedali celo kolektivno odpoved pogodb o zaposlitvi, se medtem zadeve počasi urejajo. Poleti so zaposlili tri nove zdravnice. Ker sta dve odšli, štirje pa so skrajšali delovni čas, je sicer sedaj stanje podobno, kot je bilo pred 1. majem.​Če ne bo upokojitev (nekateri zdravniki se bodo namreč lahko kmalu upokojili), se po novem letu obeta izboljšanje situacije. Zaposlili bodo še dve dosedanji specializantki. »Resne kontakte pa imamo tudi z nekaterimi zdravniki z območja nekdanje Jugoslavije,« je povedal Veternik.
text:
In Bohinj without doctors, they talk to those from the former Yugoslavia
They had to limit working hours.
05 Nov 2019, 11:29 by STA, T.V.
BOHINJ - Health center (ZD) Bohinj is forced to limit working hours due to lack of doctors. Today and a few more working days in November, the family medicine doctor will only be present in the morning. Similar problems are being pointed out in the future, but they are already known, for example, in Kranjska Gora, where there are also occasional restrictions.The ZD Bohinj employs three doctors of family medicine who perform curative and preventative activities, and have an outpatient clinic once a week, In addition to their regular work in the outpatient clinic, they also perform emergency medical care and replacement duties, a mortuary service and other tasks. ”Due to the different objective absences of all three family medicine doctors in November and in the following months, and due to the great shortage of doctors in Gorenjska and in Slovenia as well, we find that it will not be possible to organize the presence of a family doctor at the Bohinj Health Center every day between 7am and 8pm, "Bohinj was informed by Primary Health Care of Gorenjska (OZG).
Emergency aid in Bled
The doctor of family medicine in Bohinj will be present only until 1:30 pm today, 11, 12 and 28 November; In the meantime, citizens and patients will be provided with urgent medical help at the Bled ZD. "The management of the OZG Institute and the employees at ZD Bohinj apologize, but given the current situation, no other organization is possible," they explained. OZG director Joze Veternik told the STA that they will seek a solution at a meeting with representatives of the municipality and doctors next week. In Bohinj they are used to being a doctor. According to Veternik, at least for the last 20 years, despite the difficulties they have had in the OCG, they are now for the first time forced into this measure. Previously, they were able to solve problems especially with young doctors from other health centers.
Even worse in Kranjska Gora
Because of the three absences, with three absences, it is very difficult to provide uninterrupted healthcare, and it is also difficult to provide replacements, since there are also no doctors in Bled. General physicians and specialists are also lacking elsewhere in the Gorenjska region, explained Veternik. In Kranjska Gora, the situation is even worse than in Bohinj, since only two doctors work, and without the help of doctors from Jesenice it would not be possible to organize work normally. However, occasionally there is an outage when they cannot guarantee the presence of a doctor all day. They also do not have full-day dispensaries in some smaller places, such as Cerklje, Preddvor, Sencur and Naklo.
In Kranj, the situation is regulated
In the Kranj ZD, where the biggest problems have erupted this year and where doctors have even announced a collective cancellation of employment contracts in the spring, things are slowly resolving. Three new doctors were recruited in the summer. Since two have left and four have been shortening their working hours, the situation is similar to what it was before May 1. If there is no retirement (some doctors may soon retire), the situation is expected to improve after the New Year. Two more specialist students will be employed. "We also have serious contacts with some doctors from the former Yugoslavia," said Veternik.
